IMPORTANT: Check your emails.

Dear Parents & Guardians -
In the event that we adopt our hybrid model, half of our students will be coming on A days and the other half will be coming on B days. Families may need to have certain students attending school on the same day due to carpooling needs. We are already aware of siblings that would need to be kept together for the same days, so you do not need to include siblings for this survey. This survey is for you to indicate other students that your child will be carpooling with.

This information is needed for us to complete the scheduling process for all students. This survey will only be available until Tuesday, August 18th. Any request for changes to our A/B groupings after the 18th will likely not be possible unless there is a request from another family that allows us to keep the groups balanced.
You do not need to complete this survey if your child does not carpool with anyone.
Best-
Erik Arnold & Melissa Kapeckas
High School & Middle School Principals

“Students are more likely to thrive if they feel safe and have a sense of belonging—and if they have parents, adults, teachers, and friends who they know care about their success,” says Kathleen Ethier, Ph.D., director of the CDC’s Division of Adolescent and School Health.
